title: Oil giants plan to bury massive amounts of CO2 in Southeast Asia
summary: LONDON/SINGAPORE/JAKARTA (March 28): Just as they first ventured to do over a century ago, the world’s largest oil companies are staking claims far from home — this time to swallow, rather than spew, planet-warming industrial emissions.
content:
LONDON/SINGAPORE/JAKARTA (March 28): Just as they first ventured to do over a century ago, the world’s largest oil companies are staking claims far from home — this time to swallow, rather than spew, planet-warming industrial emissions.

Carbon dioxide storage is emerging as a potential multi-billion-dollar revenue stream for firms like Exxon Mobil Corp, Shell Plc and Chevron Corp.,which are under global pressure to rein in the unfettered burning of fossil fuels.
